main event: A civilian observed a bright light moving rapidly in the sky over Tucson, Arizona, on February 21, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as being about the size of a half-dollar and exhibited sudden changes in direction and speed,The object faded out twice during the observation but did not produce any sound or trail,The sighting lasted between 3 to 10 minutes,The observation was conducted from the ground using radar information,The object was noted as behaving more or less like a standard observation from an unknown source.
sighted object: a bright light moving in the sky
witness description: a civilian who reported the sighting
